resources.string: Are you sure about deleting all hosts from blacklist?
Are you sure about deleting all saved files?
Are you sure about deleting all sessions?
Your device seems not to be rooted..\narPoffeine requires root access to work!
Do you really want to quit ?
Do you want to leave the web-site?
You must accept this disclaimer in order to use this application!

arPoffeine distributes without any warranty!
Use this software on your own risk.
The developer is not responsible for any damages caused by usage of this program.
This program is designed for research purposes only, its use may be illegal in some countries, keep that in mind.
Try to capture any sessions, regardless of the filter

Before reading the instructions carefully read the disclaimer, to avoid unnecessary questions.
This program is written exclusively to research security vulnerabilities of the WLAN.

Following are answers to FAQ:
This program steals HTTP sessions in WLAN through ARP-Spoofing and then opens these sessions in the built-in browser.

The program runs the compiled ARPSpoof libraries and the modified Sniffex code for the WLAN of the libpcap library in separate services that perform all the work.\nThe ARPSpoof library deals with ARP-Spoofing, and Sniffex at this time listens and collects sessions that are redirected to the device.
Then what is ARP and ARP-Spoofing?

Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) is a telecommunications protocol used for resolution of network layer addresses into link layer addresses, a critical function in multiple-access networks.
ARP spoofing is a technique whereby an attacker sends fake (“spoofed”) Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) messages onto a Local Area Network.
Generally, the aim is to associate the attacker’s MAC address with the IP address of another host (such as the default gateway), causing any traffic meant for that IP address to be sent to the attacker instead.
The attack can only be used on networks that make use of the Address Resolution Protocol (ARP), and is limited to local network segments.
Why it’s not always possible to steal sessions from web-sites like Facebook, VK, Youtube?

Many sites are already protected with SSL, so this program can not bypass it yet.\nHowever, sessions from some of these sites can sometimes be intercepted through other sites that make appropriate queries on other domains.
What kind of two modes does the program use?
The “Filter mode” collects sessions only from those domains that are marked in the filter list, and “Generic mode” collects sessions from any sites.
Why sometimes the program may disrupt the work of the router?

This arises because of ARP-Spoofing, because the attack performs immediately on all connected devices, forcing them to redirect traffic to your device.\nAlso, different routers in different ways update their ARP table, which is why the other devices do not immediately able to connect again to the router after you have turned off the program.
Why the program does not catch anything?

Usually it depends on the following factors:
- The router has a specific protection, which can not be bypassed with simple ARP-Spoofing.
- Some devices failed to perform this attack, because of what their traffic is still not redirected to your device.

In this case, you can only try to stop the program, wait a couple of minutes, until the ARP router table is updated, and press again the start button.
Why come across “empty” sessions without accounts?

There are many sites that do not have a system with users, they have only information content, so the cookie files that they save on your device is only informative.\nSites that work with users usually store identification data in cookie files to recognize the user, but the program not always succeed in capturing a full session.
How do I know that program works?
When the program runs, you should see the status “Working”.
Why the program might not work on my device?

The reasons may be different:
-Your device is not powerful enough, usually you need at least 2 processor cores
-Libraries could not start on the architecture of your processor
-There may also be problems with the network, or other problems with your device.
Will the work on the program continue?
Yes, the work will continue in my spare time.
